publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3002# Alasdair Morgan: Current Situation in the Middle East-That the Parliament expresses its deep concern about the situation in the Middle East; recognises the key role of the United Nations and the rule of international law, and affirms that the immediate cessation of violence, the recognition and protection of human rights and the need for negotiation are essential in order to secure just and long lasting peace in the region. Supported by: Richard Lochhead*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Christine Grahame*, Mr Andrew Welsh*, Michael Matheson*, Michael Russell*
S1M-3002# Current Situation in the Middle East (lodged on 17 April 2002) Stewart Stevenson*, Shona Robison*, Bruce Crawford*

S1M-3002# Alasdair Morgan: Current Situation in the Middle East-That the Parliament expresses its deep concern about the situation in the Middle East; recognises the key role of the United Nations and the rule of international law, and affirms that the immediate cessation of violence, the recognition and protection of human rights and the need for negotiation are essential in order to secure just and long lasting peace in the region. Supported by: Richard Lochhead, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Christine Grahame, Mr Andrew Welsh, Michael Matheson, Michael Russell, Stewart Stevenson, Shona Robison, Bruce Crawford, Fiona McLeod*, Linda Fabiani*
S1M-3002# Current Situation in the Middle East (lodged on 17 April 2002) Brian Adam*
S1M-3002# Current Situation in the Middle East (lodged on 17 April 2002) Kay Ullrich*
S1M-3002# Current Situation in the Middle East (lodged on 17 April 2002) Andrew Wilson*
S1M-3002# Current Situation in the Middle East (lodged on 17 April 2002) Fiona Hyslop*, Mr George Reid*

S1M-3002# Alasdair Morgan: Current Situation in the Middle East-That the Parliament expresses its deep concern about the situation in the Middle East; recognises the key role of the United Nations and the rule of international law, and affirms that the immediate cessation of violence, the recognition and protection of human rights and the need for negotiation are essential in order to secure just and long lasting peace in the region. Supported by: Richard Lochhead, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Christine Grahame, Mr Andrew Welsh, Michael Matheson, Michael Russell, Stewart Stevenson, Shona Robison, Bruce Crawford, Fiona McLeod, Linda Fabiani, Brian Adam, Kay Ullrich, Andrew Wilson, Fiona Hyslop, Mr George Reid, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Ms Sandra White*
S1M-3002# Current Situation in the Middle East (lodged on 17 April 2002) Colin Campbell*, Tricia Marwick*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Irene McGugan*, Alex Neil*
S1M-3002# Current Situation in the Middle East (lodged on 17 April 2002) Robin Harper*, Dr Winnie Ewing*, Mr John McAllion*, Pauline McNeill*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Dennis Canavan*
